basic.floral_language:
Haworthia retusa var. riyuetan
Floriography: elegant, bright, blessed
Has a very similar appearance to Haworthia cymbiformis var.triebnet poelln, fleshy leaves arranged in a short rosette, appears like a triangular shape on the same plane, leaves fresh to dark green, marked by several dark green patches, crystal-clear bright, grows slowly, may be grown alone, or used in combinations with other plants in pots.
Likes half shaded environments, avoid direct strong sunlight, need shade properly under scattered light. Flowers sometimes, white color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green to light purple

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, put in places with scattered light, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
